meanings.definition: Having the same form, manner, or degree in all instances.
meanings.sent1: The uniforms of the team were the uniformest I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: Her handwriting was the uniformest in the entire class.
meanings.sent3: The robot's movements were so uniformest that it almost seemed human.
meanings.sent4: The rows of trees in the orchard stood in uniformest lines, like soldiers at attention.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rule about dress code ensured that the students' outfits were uniformest.

meanings.definition: Consistently conforming to one principle, standard, or pattern.
meanings.sent1: The company's products were the uniformest in quality.
meanings.sent2: She always maintained the uniformest level of professionalism in her work.
meanings.sent3: The chef's cakes were so uniformest in size that they looked like clones.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed against the shore in a uniformest rhythm, like a heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The garden was meticulously maintained, with the flowers in the uniformest arrangement.
